metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5339 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 3.5.x before 3.5.3 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted name of (1) an event, (2) a procedure, or (3) a trigger.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:3.5.8.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:3.5.8.1-1').
